publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-746# Mr Lloyd Quinan: Autistic Spectrum Disorder—That the Parliament notes that the incidence of the childhood condition autistic spectrum disorder has increased considerably in the last ten years; further notes that data relating to this condition is not routinely centrally collected, and believes that an independent research study requires to be undertaken in order to establish the mechanisms which cause autistic spectrum disorder and so allow preventative action to be taken.
S1M-746# Autistic Spectrum Disorder (lodged on 5 April 2000) Scott Barrie*, Donald Gorrie*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Shona Robison*, Margaret Jamieson*, Fergus Ewing*
S1M-746# Autistic Spectrum Disorder (lodged on 5 April 2000) Fergus Ewing*, Brian Adam*, Mr Duncan Hamilton*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Mr Brian Monteith*, Michael Matheson*R
S1M-746# Autistic Spectrum Disorder (lodged on 5 April 2000) Alex Neil*, Dr Winnie Ewing*

S1M-746# Mr Lloyd Quinan: Autistic Spectrum Disorder—That the Parliament notes that the incidence of the childhood condition autistic spectrum disorder has increased considerably in the last ten years; further notes that data relating to this condition is not routinely centrally collected, and believes that an independent research study requires to be undertaken in order to establish the mechanisms which cause autistic spectrum disorder and so allow preventative action to be taken. Supported by: Scott Barrie, Donald Gorrie, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Shona Robison, Margaret Jamieson, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Fergus Ewing, Brian Adam, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Mr Brian Monteith, Michael Matheson R, Alex Neil, Dr Winnie Ewing, Hugh Henry*
S1M-746# Autistic Spectrum Disorder (lodged on 5 April 2000) Mr Adam Ingram*, Trish Godman*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Fiona Hyslop*
S1M-746# Autistic Spectrum Disorder (lodged on 5 April 2000) Tricia Marwick*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Andrew Wilson*, Bruce Crawford*, Christine Grahame*
S1M-746# Autistic Spectrum Disorder (lodged on 5 April 2000) Mary Scanlon*, Elaine Smith*, Kay Ullrich*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*

S1M-746# Mr Lloyd Quinan: Autistic Spectrum Disorder—That the Parliament notes that the incidence of the childhood condition autistic spectrum disorder has increased considerably in the last ten years; further notes that data relating to this condition is not routinely centrally collected, and believes that an independent research study requires to be undertaken in order to establish the mechanisms which cause autistic spectrum disorder and so allow preventative action to be taken. Supported by: Scott Barrie, Donald Gorrie, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Shona Robison, Margaret Jamieson, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Fergus Ewing, Brian Adam, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Mr Brian Monteith, Michael Matheson R, Alex Neil, Dr Winnie Ewing, Hugh Henry, Mr Adam Ingram, Trish Godman, Dr Elaine Murray, Fiona Hyslop, Tricia Marwick, Mr Gil Paterson, Andrew Wilson, Bruce Crawford, Christine Grahame, Mary Scanlon, Elaine Smith, Kay Ullrich, Mr Kenny MacAskill
S1M-746# Autistic Spectrum Disorder (lodged on 5 April 2000) Mr Keith Harding*
S1M-746# Autistic Spectrum Disorder (lodged on 5 April 2000) Mr Michael McMahon*, Robin Harper*, Linda Fabiani*, Robert Brown*
S1M-746# Autistic Spectrum Disorder (lodged on 5 April 2000) Cathy Jamieson*

S1M-746# Mr Lloyd Quinan: Autistic Spectrum Disorder—That the Parliament notes that the incidence of the childhood condition autistic spectrum disorder has increased considerably in the last ten years; further notes that data relating to this condition is not routinely centrally collected, and believes that an independent research study requires to be undertaken in order to establish the mechanisms which cause autistic spectrum disorder and so allow preventative action to be taken. Supported by: Scott Barrie, Donald Gorrie, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Shona Robison, Margaret Jamieson, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Fergus Ewing, Brian Adam, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Mr Brian Monteith, Michael Matheson R, Alex Neil, Dr Winnie Ewing, Hugh Henry, Mr Adam Ingram, Trish Godman, Dr Elaine Murray, Fiona Hyslop, Tricia Marwick, Mr Gil Paterson, Andrew Wilson, Bruce Crawford, Christine Grahame, Mary Scanlon, Elaine Smith, Kay Ullrich, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Mr Keith Harding, Mr Michael McMahon, Robin Harper, Linda Fabiani, Robert Brown, Cathy Jamieson, Mike Watson*, Phil Gallie*, Ms Sandra White*
S1M-746# Autistic Spectrum Disorder (lodged on 5 April 2000) Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-746# Autistic Spectrum Disorder (lodged on 5 April 2000) Mr John McAllion*

S1M-746# Mr Lloyd Quinan: Autistic Spectrum Disorder-That the Parliament notes that the incidence of the childhood condition autistic spectrum disorder has increased considerably in the last ten years; further notes that data relating to this condition is not routinely centrally collected, and believes that an independent research study requires to be undertaken in order to establish the mechanisms which cause autistic spectrum disorder and so allow preventative action to be taken. S1M-746# Mr Lloyd Quinan: Autistic Spectrum Disorder—That the Parliament notes that the incidence of the childhood condition autistic spectrum disorder has increased considerably in the last ten years; further notes that data relating to this condition is not routinely centrally collected, and believes that an independent research study requires to be undertaken in order to establish the mechanisms which cause autistic spectrum disorder and so allow preventative action to be taken. S1M-746# Mr Lloyd Quinan: Autistic Spectrum Disorder-That the Parliament notes that the incidence of the childhood condition autistic spectrum disorder has increased considerably in the last ten years; further notes that data relating to this condition is not routinely centrally collected, and believes that an independent research study requires to be undertaken in order to establish the mechanisms which cause autistic spectrum disorder and so allow preventative action to be taken.
